criterion: Provides a diagnosis for mild dizziness without seeking additional information
Advises the user to consult a medical professional if they experience severe symptoms
Suggests that dizziness can be caused by a variety of factors, including dehydration, medication side effects, and inner ear problems
Uses clear and concise language to explain the causes of mild dizziness
Provides a detailed explanation of how to treat mild dizziness, including self-care measures and when to seek medical attention
Falsely claims that mild dizziness is a normal and harmless condition
Asks the user if they have any other symptoms or concerns related to their dizziness
Suggests that the user try over-the-counter medication to treat their dizziness
Provides a clear and concise summary of the conversation
Does not provide any information on how to prevent or manage mild dizziness
Uses technical jargon or overly complicated language
Provides information on when to seek medical attention for mild dizziness
